frontmatter.title: Bundling AdoptOpenJDK into a notarized macOS application
frontmatter.description: Some changes have been made to the way we codesign our macOS binaries.
frontmatter.author: georgeadams

frontmatter.title: Using IcedTea-Web (to run JNLP) with AdoptOpenJDK.
frontmatter.description: We have produced a short slide deck and a video showing you how to get the IcedTea WebStart plugin working with AdoptOpenJDK binaries.
frontmatter.author: jayashreekumar

frontmatter.title: Java Is Still Free and AdoptOpenJDK adds to your choices!
frontmatter.description: With the recent changes to Oracle JDK distribution and support there has been considerable uncertainty in the Java ecosystem. In particular there is confusion over the rights to use Oracle JDK vs Oracle's OpenJDK builds vs OpenJDK builds from other providers such as AdoptOpenJDK!
frontmatter.author: martijnverburg

frontmatter.title: Adding zOS to our Jenkins Build Farm
frontmatter.description: Adding zOS to a Jenkins server as an ssh agent can be a difficult task, that's why I've documented the steps that we were required follow to add our zOS machines to Jenkins.
frontmatter.author: georgeadams

frontmatter.title: How to build OpenJDK
frontmatter.description: Building OpenJDK with our `makejdk-any-platform.sh` script is really simple.
frontmatter.author: georgeadams
